summary: Imagine this: You’re driving down the road when a Very Good Idea springs to mind.  You need to capture it quickly without fumbling through screens or struggling with Siri, which often requires internet access and can be hit-or-miss.  What you need is a seamless solution that promptly activates a voice recording, saves your thoughts, and sends them to your preferred app without any fuss...
title: ‘Dictate a Note’ is my new favorite shortcut (and that’s saying something)

summary:
Yesterday, James (of James’ Coffee Blog) announced his newest web project, Artemis.  He billed it as “a calm web reader” that he uses “to follow my favourite blogs and websites” with three main design goals:


I want Artemis to be part of a web exploration journey, so every web link takes you to the author’s websites. 
I want the interface to make me feel calm, not overwhelmed like other readers...
title: First Impressions of Artemis: James’ ‘Calm Web Reader’

summary: I want to experiment with analog and digital communication using a very low-cost USB sound card and GNU Radio.  Before I try that, I should understand how it will distort the signal.  Enter chirps...
title: Sweeping frequencies with GNU Radio
